context: The Estonian word 'terve' is a versatile adjective with multiple meanings depending on context. It can mean 'healthy' when referring to people or animals (e.g., 'terve inimene' - healthy person), but also means 'whole', 'entire', or 'complete' when describing objects, periods of time, or quantities (e.g., 'terve p채ev' - whole day). It can indicate that something is intact and undamaged ('terve maja' - intact house) or natural/normal ('terve m천istus' - sound/common sense). In addition to these literal meanings, 'terve' appears in greetings like 'Olge terveks!' which functions as a well-wishing expression similar to 'Stay healthy!'
